Txt_Talk_DreamCastle_QueenRoom_MAIN_0_VO.Text:
Hm hm hm! Soon!
Soon the jewel will be mine!
Those fools across the border have kept it quite long enough!
And it will suit me so much better! Hm hm hm hm hm!

Txt_Talk_DreamCastle_QueenRoom_MAIN_0_AC.Text: Whatever are you doing here, soldier? You do know that our beloved kingdom is in grave danger, don't you?
Yes, those horrible rascals from across the border are planning on invading.
But our wise king knows this, and is preparing a daring and clever pre-emptive strike!
The troops will be mobilising soon. You too must play your part, brave soldier.

Txt_Talk_DreamCastle_ThroneRoom_MAIN_0_V.Text: Listen, men! Those dastardly criminals from across the border are readying an assault!
But thanks to my dear wife, we have been lucky enough to learn of their wicked plan ahead of time!
They cannot be allowed to invade our beloved motherland! Therefore, we must strike first!
Is that not so, General Hannibal?
Yes, Your Majesty! If this information is correct, it will indeed be in our best interests to strike first.
Ho ho ho! You need not worry on that score, Hannibal! What could my dear wife hope to gain from lying?
She has no conceivable motive for deceiving us. Or do you believe otherwise? Hm?

Very well, then. Go forth, men!
For the honour of our beloved realm!

Txt_Talk_DreamCastle_ThroneRoom_MAIN_0_A.Text: Hm? I do not recall your face, soldier. Is there something you wish to say to me?
What's that? You are no soldier? Then leave this place! You have no business here.
Then what are you waiting for!?
Quick, off to battle with you! The others left some time ago!
Oh, whatever am I to do...?
Hm? Who are you? And what are you doing here? Gah, what am I saying? This is no time for such petty concerns!
Listen<--->I must ask you something. Something purely hypothetical...with no basis in fact whatsoever...
Let us suppose that a certain king had given certain orders...and that those orders happened to be...misguided. They are still the orders of a king, and must be obeyed no matter what. Correct?
Really? You truly believe the orders of a king to be so set in stone?

No? You really think so?
So you believe that misguided orders need not be followed?

What silliness is this?
Are you even listening to me?

You seem a little confused.
Let me ask you once more...
I see. So you think that even the orders of a king, if mistaken, need not be followed?
Hmm. I suppose that even one's idea of what is correct and what is mistaken is entirely personal...
So you believe it better to do what I see fit than to blindly follow the orders of the king?
So at times such as this, I must have faith in my king, and follow his orders, you say?

Hm? So I can neither follow my own will, nor the orders of my king?
And where exactly does that leave me?
Never mind. I was a fool to ask a stranger such a question.

I know now what I must do.
You may leave.
Hmm. This is what you would do? Truly?
Hmm. Your answers are somewhat...wilful... But perhaps sometimes it is necessary to be so.
